medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, specifically worsening in the right lower quadrant (RLQ)
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presented with one day of abdominal pain, starting with pain in both lower quadrants, but has worsened in the RLQ. He also experienced diarrhea and some nausea but no vomiting. Symptoms began yesterday.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 1. End-Stage Renal Disease (anuric) on HD TuThSa 2. Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus complicated by gastroparesis 3. Recurrent Hypertension emergency/urgency 4. Chronic left flank pain possibly due to diabetic polyneuropathy 5. Chronic Diastolic Congestive Heart Failure 6. Esophagitis/Gastritis/Duodenitis 7. Depression with prior suicide attempt 8. Fibromyalgia 9. Moderate to severe cognitive deficits 10. Migraine Headaches
medical_history.family_history: Mother has diabetes and ovarian cancer. Two brothers have diabetes. Three sisters: one with hypertension and one with gestational diabetes. No history of coronary artery disease.
